org.jcatapult.commerce.service
Interface CommerceService

All Known Implementing Classes:
AuthorizeNetCommerceService
public interface CommerceService

This interface defines the most common operations for commerce via an online merchant. This interface doesn't define how the application will handle the result of successful or unsuccessful commerce submission, it only defines how the payments are submitted to commerce gateways.

Method Summary
 ChargeResult chargeCard(org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.CreditCard creditCard, org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money amount, org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money tax, InetAddress userIp)
          Charges the given credit and the given amount.
 VerifyResult verifyCard(org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.CreditCard creditCard, org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money amount, org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money tax, InetAddress userIp)
          Verifies that the credit card is valid by pre-authing the amount given.
 

Method Detail

chargeCard

ChargeResult chargeCard(org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.CreditCard creditCard,
                        org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money amount,
                        org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money tax,
                        InetAddress userIp)
                        throws CommerceException
Charges the given credit and the given amount.

Parameters:
creditCard - The credit card.
amount - The amount to charge the credit card. This should include the tax.
tax - The amount of the transaction that is tax.
userIp - The IP address of the client computer that is submitting the commerce request. This is used for fraud tracking.
Returns:
The transaction result from the commerce gateway.
Throws:
CommerceException - If the charge failed.

verifyCard

VerifyResult verifyCard(org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.CreditCard creditCard,
                        org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money amount,
                        org.jcatapult.domain.commerce.Money tax,
                        InetAddress userIp)
                        throws CommerceException
Verifies that the credit card is valid by pre-authing the amount given. Some gateways have other means of verification, but this is the most common. This pre-auth will revert after an amount of time specified by the gateway or the credit cards bank.

Parameters:
creditCard - The credit card.
amount - The amount to pre-auth the credit card. This should include the tax.
tax - The amount of the transaction that is tax.
userIp - The IP address of the client computer that is submitting the commerce request. This is used for fraud tracking.
Returns:
The verify result from the commerce gateway.
Throws:
CommerceException - If the verify failed.
